website_summaries.verdict: Numerous easy-to-follow recipes make this a suitable cookbook for novice vegetarians and cooks who only occasionally prepare meat-free meals.
pros: A revised version of a popular vegetarian cookbook that contains modern recipes and vegan options
Author is an experienced writer on food topics
Book and the recipes in it are put together nicely and easy to follow
Kindle and hardcover options are available
cons: Many of the recipes are basic, and may not appeal to longtime vegetarians
Some mistakes and missing pages reported

customer_reviews.title: and has nice photography as well
customer_reviews.text: I just gave away my second copy of the older edition of this book and needed to replace it. This book is improved over the older one, and has nice photography as well. I love to cook and find Mark Bittman's books invaluable reference material. Excellent for researching ingredients, and as always, the simplicity of a basic recipe, followed by alternative versions, and recipe additions - all great! Our family is mostly vegetarian (no red meat at all) And I try to cook vegan most weekday evenings. I've found the recipes helpful for providing nutritional balance and full flavor.
customer_reviews.author: Chandra

customer_reviews.title: One of the better cookbooks I now have on my shelf
customer_reviews.text: Wow! One of the better cookbooks I now have on my shelf. The layout and presentation of info is clear and easy to read and figure out. Many recipes to try. I'm a cook with many years of experience and I found myself learning from this book. This alone makes it a great cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better Books Out There
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after enjoying Bitterman's How to Cook Everything: The Basics. While the other book is a kitchen staple for skills, this book (like many of his veggie recipes in the other book) is not a keeper. The recipes miss the mark and simply don't taste good. Hardly any pictures of the finished product. It wasn't worth keeping on my shelf.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners and experts alike
customer_reviews.text: I love this book and have been working my way through the recipes. I especially appreciate that Bittman has created lighter versions of some of the old standards by using less cheese. The photos are beautiful and the step by step instructions are clear.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Helpful for those not that familiar with cooking.
customer_reviews.text: I like the overall set up of the book and pictures. Also a huge plus how the recipes can be adapted to vegan for those needing to avoid dairy or egg. I really like too how simple dishes are included along with instructions. This book is exactly what I was looking for to comprehensively go over the aspects of vegan/vegetarian cooking but provides plenty of variety in recipes for the more adventurous.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of great recipes and I love the fact that he lists ...
customer_reviews.text: Lots of great recipes and I love the fact that he lists alternatives for gluten free, dairy free, etc. Like all cookbooks, it could use more photos of the food, but there are very nice illustrations for techniques.
customer_reviews.author: tikimonkey

customer_reviews.title: Many recipes. Not photos
customer_reviews.text: Very inclusive but the book is a Tome! I like and respect Mr. Bittman and his cooking but this book is so dense that it is somewhat discouraging. And, since I’m a visual person, the lack of photos is sad. More like an encyclopedia
customer_reviews.author: L. Brooks

customer_reviews.title: I have his original How to Cook Everything and have never been disappointed in it so I knew this would be a ...
customer_reviews.text: I recently discovered that I had been bitten by a tick that caused the Alpha-G allergy (an allergy to mammal meat) so I knew just where to turn. One of my first purchases as I navigate this new mammal-meat free life was Mark Bittman's How to Cook Everything. I have his original How to Cook Everything and have never been disappointed in it so I knew this would be a must have in my kitchen library. His books should be a staple for every home kitchen. So far everything I have tried has turned out great and wow, this is a huge book so I have recipes to last a lifetime!
customer_reviews.author: Malissa Coy

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous new book by Mark Bittman
customer_reviews.text: Spectacular book. Science, wisdom, and technique in one volume. I am working my way through the book and so far, every recipe is dead on and I have learned something new. Love the pizza recipes, oh my they are good. I am a very experienced home cook that has (with Hubs on board) become vegetarian. I highly recommend this treasure.
customer_reviews.author: T. Weber

customer_reviews.title: Mark Bittman always easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy the way Mark Bittman presents his recipes with so many options so you can cook out of your pantry or with the vegetables you obtained at the farmer's market or seasonal choices at Whole Foods. I have not made it through the book yet but did make a minestrone page 109 that was fantastic. I was looking to use up some leftover bean mix and found this recipe. Will definitely make that often.
customer_reviews.author: D. Elsen

customer_reviews.title: Cooking Vegetarian with Bittman is great and tasty !
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cookbook, with Mark Bittman’s usual attention to detail and excitement of the subject matter. He is not a vegetarian and doesn’t want the reader to become one. But for our health and the health of the planet, we all should eat more plants and vegetables. His recipes are easy, very flexible and interchangeable and extremely flavorful. We are trying new ones almost every night.
customer_reviews.author: wallatom

customer_reviews.title: Great for experienced and novice home cooks!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book and the level of detail Mark Bittman includes is perfect for experienced and novice home cooks! For example, I’ve been making scrambled eggs for a couple decades, but his easy to follow directions (start with a cold pan, add some cream/water) brought my scrambled eggs to another level!! For experienced cooks you can skim over some of the details and jump to the recipes. For novice home cooks you can read all the details. I checked this book out from the library and loved it so much that I bought it! It’s a keeper
customer_reviews.author: Nova mom

customer_reviews.title: but taste like they came out of a restaurant
customer_reviews.text: Has so many recipes its tough to pick one! If you are on the fence, JUST BUY IT! It gives endless food inspiration, and there are so many recipes that take literally less than 2 minutes to make, but taste like they came out of a restaurant. Simple and incredible recipes! Put this book in your cart right now and buy it! You won't be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Dolores D

customer_reviews.title: Electronic version of a favorite
customer_reviews.text: I find lately that I like using my tablet for recipes rather than physical books. This way I don't need to make room for books in the kitchen, and I prefer a link to paging through the book. Also small splashes can just be wiped off and don't become a permanent part of the book. This book has been one of my favorites for years and this e-book version replaces an well worn hardcover version.
customer_reviews.author: ainsworth

customer_reviews.title: A great cookbook for anyone!
customer_reviews.text: I have learned a lot about cooking from this book! I love the tortilla soup recipe as well as the French bread and pizza recipes! There are explanations, pictures and diagrams that facilitate learning how and why each step is done. This is my favorite cookbook and has helped me to introduce more vegetables into my family's life. The recipes are well rounded, and meat is not missed!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Mark Bittman
customer_reviews.text: We have most of the Mark Bittman cookbooks and find them the ones we turn to the most. Recipes are easy to prepare and almost all of them have been a great success. We will continue to get MR. Bittman's books as we find ones that we do not currently have.
customer_reviews.author: Larry182

customer_reviews.title: Greta book.  Get it.  (Even if you eat meat!)
customer_reviews.text: Great book with lots of easy, tasty and well prepared recipes. And a wealth of cooking tips and info. Well worth adding to anyone's recipe book collection, Its not just for vegetarians, but for anyone who wants to cook a variety of vegetables well.
customer_reviews.author: Northwest ELF

customer_reviews.title: REALLY COMPREHENSIVE
customer_reviews.text: Just starting out with this cookbook, but it looks amazing so far - packed with information in addition to great sounding recipes. I like Mark Bittman and appreciate that he has created a vegetarian version of his work. Another thing I appreciate is that on many of the recipes, he tells how to make it vegan if you want to.....very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Kilpper

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Good Things to Make
customer_reviews.text: I have this book in the Kindle version, on my computer, but I found that I was running back and forth from the dining room (where my computer is) to the kitchen when making a meal. I just decided to get the book instead and keep it in the kitchen while I am cooking. This is a very large, thick book, with tons of recipes and ideas. A good book for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Bear

customer_reviews.title: Must-have!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must-have for any home cook. Even if you are not a vegetarian (which we aren't), it's hard sometimes to think of things to cook that don't revolve around some sort of meat or fish. We have a lot of cookbooks and this is by far the most comprehensive when it comes to cooking vegetables. It also makes a great gift and will encourage people to cook more vegetables. We also have Mark Bittman's How to Cook Everything, which I also highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: this book gives you the foundation to cook any recipe in a vegetarian way!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome book. It truly is ‘Everything’ you want to know and more importantly understand about Vegetarian cooking & eating. As others have said, this book gives you the foundation to cook any recipe in a vegetarian way. Best resource/cookbook I’ve invested in in years.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Butler

customer_reviews.title: Loaded with great ideas
customer_reviews.text: I received a previous addition as a gift and it's one of the 3 cookbooks I actually reference with regularity. I've sat down and skimmed the book for long periods of time because there's so much in there to spark your culinary inspiration. I've since gifted this newest version to friends who are looking for more meatless meal options.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Bacon

customer_reviews.title: Comprehensive and Great Details
customer_reviews.text: Literally it is about how to cook everything vegetarian. The recipes are good and mostly easy for moderately skillful cooks like myself. Lots of great info on how to cook grains, veggies, etc. Great addition to my cookbook library and sure I'll refer to it again and again and again.
customer_reviews.author: CLA

customer_reviews.title: 😐
customer_reviews.text: Kinda cool. Lots of stuff inside but hard to navigate. Should have been split up into groups easier. Also should have put a No 2 Low carb section in there for people avoiding rice, noodles, grains, breads, carbs.
customer_reviews.author: little white

customer_reviews.title: Misrepresentation of Book
customer_reviews.text: Product NOT as advertised-older edition of book PHOTO VERY MISLEADING
customer_reviews.author: Tracy Abc Burke

customer_reviews.title: Mark Bittman - Vegetarian Cooking.
customer_reviews.text: It’s going to take a while to go through this, but Mark Bittman has a terrific book fir Vegetarian Cooking. I’m drifting over more and more to this type of cooking and I expect to use this cookbook over and over. I’ve found that any cookbook he has a hand in is worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: SJB

customer_reviews.title: A great cookbook: move toward a plant-based diet and feel better.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful cookbook for everyone who wants to eat healthier and more ethically.
customer_reviews.author: James Zachary

customer_reviews.title: We are not vegetarians but my wife loves the book ...
customer_reviews.text: We are not vegetarians but my wife loves the book and we plan on using a couple of evenings a week to supplement our meat intake.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Newman

customer_reviews.title: Literally EVERYTHING
customer_reviews.text: Bittman strikes again! It's so easy to feel like you're capable in the kitchen with his vast knowledge and clear writing style. He makes even things I was intimidated by so accessible, this is a book I'll come back to over and over and over.
customer_reviews.author: LENORE V LUDLOW

customer_reviews.title: Good for all omnivorous beginners, basic knowledge here
customer_reviews.text: Very, very basic. If you cook more than steak on a regular basis then there is really nothing to see here. My husband who is clueless with cooking would benefit from this book, but it really is not necessary for me personally. It's a well written organized book for the beginner who doesn't know where to start. I'll be on a continued search for a more complicated vegetarian cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: Akatz

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Variety
customer_reviews.text: So many yummy recipes to choose! Great presentation with a lot of pictures. This is a BIG book!
customer_reviews.author: Momknows

customer_reviews.title: Probably the best recipe book I own!
customer_reviews.text: This book contains such a wealth of information - it’s a goldmine, containing information I didn’t know I wanted or needed. You must get it - you won’t be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Diane Romane

customer_reviews.title: Great reviews from my daughter!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book for my daughter, who is a pescatarian (not sure that's the correct spelling, sorry), and she absolutely loves it!
customer_reviews.author: JAAscione

customer_reviews.title: A superior vegetarian cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Bittman is the best, and this is far better than the other veggie cookbooks I've bought.
customer_reviews.author: Consequences Schmonsequences

customer_reviews.title: This cookbook is GOLD!
customer_reviews.text: This cook book is vegetarian GOLD! We reference is all the time and there are a lot recommendations on how to veganise items within it... helpful for when we're entertaining all of our vegan friends!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: I'm not vegetarian and this book is fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I am a regular meat eater and I would recommend this book to anyone who owns a kitchen, vegetarian or not! It is fantastically written and has a great layout. It's almost like cookbook meets textbook, fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Emily A.

customer_reviews.title: Good content but awkward to use
customer_reviews.text: Well written and certainly informative BUT the book is heavy and unwieldy. Should be broken up into maybe three books and that would allow the print to be made larger.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Ziehm

customer_reviews.title: The Only One You Need
customer_reviews.text: Not only have I given this cookbook to many friends, but we also include one in each and every rental of ours. It's a Great book. Not everyone knows how to cook a vegetarian meal. One day they will, and this is the only book they will need.
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Vegetarian deliciousness
customer_reviews.text: I have loved this recipe book so much I've purchased 3 of them. One for relatives, one for friends, and one for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This has a nice selection of recipes that are good for anyone that is new to the vegetarian lifestyle(as I am) or a seasoned veteran to it.
customer_reviews.author: Chem Freak

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful book to help you to learn Vegetarian & Vegan cooking.
customer_reviews.text: It was gift to my daughter & son in law & they were Very Pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Dianna Holland

customer_reviews.title: i love this cook book
customer_reviews.text: I can sit and read this one. It is full of food that sounds delicious and not too hard to do. It says it has a lot of pictures, but i would have liked even more picture!
customer_reviews.author: Joe D. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: A must read!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this book, I love the information and the pictures and what goes good with what. So good, worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Naomi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cookbook for vegetarians (or anyone)
customer_reviews.text: I love this book as a source of "everyday" recipes. A lot of cookbooks are just a collection of recipes, but this one is more of a teaching you how to cook guide. It's exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.author: Kyra

customer_reviews.title: Good begetarian cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a Christmas gift for our daughter-in-law. She was enthralled. I am considering one for myself. Appears to be a great book with no exotic items required.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret L. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: A-to-Z Veg Tome.
customer_reviews.text: Given as a gift to someone ill, who must make vegetarian dietary changes. Recipient was delighted.
customer_reviews.author: Saultxy

customer_reviews.title: Dinner anyone?
customer_reviews.text: Really glad I bought this book. I tried a few recipes but looking forward to many more. The photos are colorful and show what your dishes can look like. A lot of recipes to choose from. I’m sure to have friends asking for another invite to dinner.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Duda

customer_reviews.title: Comprehensive
customer_reviews.text: This is my go-to cookbook now. It has recipes for everything that you might be interested in, in the vegetarian/vegan world.
customer_reviews.author: sj

customer_reviews.title: Practical information for the home cook.
customer_reviews.text: I learned a lot from this book before I even got to the recipes. This book is an invaluable resource that is a go-to for me now.
customer_reviews.author: William Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: This book has lots of delicious sounding recipes but is heavy. I wish it was spiral bound.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline

customer_reviews.title: A vegetarian Joy of Cooking?
customer_reviews.text: I thoroughly enjoy this cookbook which seems to me to be encyclopedic in scope.
customer_reviews.author: Diane Ruotsalainen

customer_reviews.title: Nice book and pictures for each recipe
customer_reviews.text: Lots of ideas for people like me who are flexitarians
customer_reviews.author: Sandrine B

customer_reviews.title: Nice book
customer_reviews.text: my son liked this cookbook as he is a vegetarian. Loved the pictures as well with each recipe which is so helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Creshanna Williams

customer_reviews.title: A must have if you're going vegetarian or vegan.
customer_reviews.text: This is very extensive and very well done. It's now my go to book for everything vegetarian.
customer_reviews.author: SLD

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Great condition for a used book. Such a large variety of recipes for every type of eater
customer_reviews.author: Lyle Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Fun variety of meals with plenty of substitution recommendations and pro-tips
customer_reviews.text: Covers tasty and unique vegetarian dishes, but features a lot of "standard" desserts and drinks that you'd expect to find in a less-specialized book.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Buzzelli

customer_reviews.title: Vegetarian cooking
customer_reviews.text: I used to get recipes from the NYT. One day I realized the majority were from Mr Bittman. So I bought his book and I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nikola

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: We are trying to eat less meat this year and this book is fantastic, recipes are very good.
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Lovely recipes
customer_reviews.text: Mark Bittman is a genius. His books don't ever disappoint. The pictures in this one are fun and helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Mkeamazon

customer_reviews.title: Nice Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Great cookbook, I love the recipes. I wish there were more cultural/ethnic recipes, more pictures and metric conversions.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Wachter

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to read with plenty of helpful advice on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to read with plenty of helpful advice on the basics. This cookbook does not skimp on the details and has realistic recipes for a wide variety of dishes. Plenty of tips on how to switch around ingredients if you are vegan.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the cost!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent cookbook as always from Bittman. Loads of great tips and easy to follow recipes.
customer_reviews.author: sally21

customer_reviews.title: Many vegetables seem unappetizing but if you know how to prep them they are great.
customer_reviews.text: Absolutley stunning photography to accompany the many recipes and tips. Many vegetables seem unappetizing but if you know how to prep them they are great.
customer_reviews.author: derek murphy

customer_reviews.title: This cookbook is great for browsing and the one recipe I’ve tried so ...
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook is great for browsing and the one recipe I’ve tried so far, the raw brussels sprouts salad (whaaaaaaaaat?) was amazing good!
customer_reviews.author: Solye Brown

customer_reviews.title: A must-have!
customer_reviews.text: Essential to re-learn to cook (I just turned vegetarian). Great and simple recipes with lots of combinations / alterations possible to the same base dishes. Really a must-have!
customer_reviews.author: Diana Bruel

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a gift, recipient loves it. This is even better than the original as it has pictures and updated recipes.
customer_reviews.author: Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Gave to my son for Christmas and he loved it! Recently cut back on meat and was ...
customer_reviews.text: Gave to my son for Christmas and he loved it! Recently cut back on meat and was tire of the same vegy recipes now have a large variety and they taste great!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica P.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a beginner cook
customer_reviews.text: Very informative and detailed book. Great for a beginner cook.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki Perk-Fields

customer_reviews.title: It's great !
customer_reviews.text: I love having some pics but not skimping on the content ..great new recipes but don't throw out the first ....both are essentials
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Useful information easily understood. Full of recipes from many culture to satisfy all palettes
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Szymanczyk

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and Useful Book
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful book with terrific range of very nice recipes. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: JCH

customer_reviews.title: Great book was a gift for my wife Nicole and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great book was a gift for my wife Nicole and she has been so pleased with it. Great recipes great insight very well done. 5 stars indeed
customer_reviews.author: Gregory nichols

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: The type used was so small that I need a magnifying page to read it
customer_reviews.author: dbrooksrnc

customer_reviews.title: I love the book I order
customer_reviews.text: I love the book I order!! I WILL tell all my friend and family to order this book I give it a 10 stars!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As someone was moving toward becoming a vegetarian I really liked what Mark had to say
customer_reviews.text: I heard about this cookbook during an NPR interview with Mark Bittman. As someone was moving toward becoming a vegetarian I really liked what Mark had to say. Perhaps we are all too used to quick recipes and pics but the one thing I would note about the cookbook is that it's almost too much and not enough pictorial descriptors to help. All in all though it's an amazing resource.
customer_reviews.author: Polly M. Marquette

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: A no frills beginner vegetarian cookbook, too simplistic for my taste
customer_reviews.author: Heavenlypet

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was a gift for my son. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Maribeth Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Everything you need to know about cooking vegetables and more.
customer_reviews.text: This is one of those books that explains everything. You can read all about a particular vegetable or just skip to the recipe. I like to read all about them since I grow much of mine. Chock full of information. I love this trend in cookbooks and can't recommend this book highly enough. It doesn't matter if you're vegetarian. You still need to cook your veggies!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa E

customer_reviews.title: Missing Pages of Great Book! Please send replacement...
customer_reviews.text: I love the cookbook but just realized pages 809-824 are missing! Key parts of the index. I am bummed because I just now discovered it and I am outside the return dates. Good case for waiving return date policy...
customer_reviews.author: Doreen Wise

customer_reviews.title: but that's still a pretty major inconvenience
customer_reviews.text: Decent cookbook, but my version had a lot of misprints, including doubled or omitted pages. Amazon replaced it, but that's still a pretty major inconvenience, especially if you are getting this as a gift.
customer_reviews.author: Smaro

customer_reviews.title: Perfect vegetarian book but wish there were more photos
customer_reviews.text: Perfect vegetarian book but wish there were more photos. I am a fan of Bittman's: love practicality and simplicity of recipes.
customer_reviews.author: mth

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It was a good book. TONS of great recipes. Would have liked something for Chicken Tendies but oh well....
customer_reviews.author: Network Administrator

customer_reviews.title: I like it but Mark have never learned that authentic Parmigiano-Reggiano ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it but Mark have never learned that authentic Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese is not vegetarian. It is required to have rennet - animal liver - in it to be authentic. Animal lover in me has a problem with this.
customer_reviews.author: Fred N. Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Not so good
customer_reviews.text: The recipes in this are not so good. Don’t really recommend
customer_reviews.author: cynthia gordon okoon

customer_reviews.title: Both the same
customer_reviews.text: If you have his first cookbook, do not purchase. There is no difference. I pulled up recipes from the first book to this one and they were word-for-word. I really thought it would be new, revised and updated. It's a great book. Just don't own two.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Book is quite boring. If you’re already a vegetarian, this book is kind of a waste.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Bent
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful book but it arrived today looking like this (attached)
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca K. Loudon

customer_reviews.title: Comprehensive vegetarian cookbook
customer_reviews.text: If you are a vegetarian or vegan or just looking to eat more plant based food, you will find this book to be most helpful. It is not a vegan cookbook but it does contain many vegan recipes. What I especially liked about this book was its reliance on fresh real food. I personally don’t care for meat analogs and vegan cheese. But a vegan can easily adapt recipes with cheese by substituting vegan cheese. The section on salads is excellent with both traditional and innovative recipes. All in all an excellent primer on vegetarian cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki S.

product_meta.title: How to Cook Everything Vegetarian: Completely Revised Tenth Anniversary Edition
